mappings.jd_requirement: 4+ years of experience as a Product Manager or Technical Product Manager

source_experience.bullet: Senior Product Manager (May 2024 - Oct 2025, 18 months)
Defined AI roadmap for Dynamic Planning suite (Web + Excel) serving 10,000+ enterprise users — integrated LLM-powered conversational workflows and predictive insights across omnichannel platforms
Defined AI roadmap for Dynamic Planning suite (Web + Excel) serving 10,000+ enterprise users — integrated LLM-powered conversational workflows and predictive insights across omnichannel platforms
Prototyped AI workflows, planned LLM-powered agents for autonomous report generation, reducing manual effort by 40%

Enhanced ML-assisted models using usage telemetry, embedding scores, and user-behavior clusters to forecast feature ROI, de-risk roadmap decisions, influence org-wide strategy for AI-enabled FP&A modernization
Streamlined onboarding and policy journeys, achieving a 25% improvement in conversion rates and enhancing sales team productivity through automation and customer journey refinement

Launched omnichannel contact center for Insurance — created workflows for policy inquiries, claims, and renewals across chat, email, defined agent routing, SLAs, and escalation logic. Delivered 75% engagement lift and 50% revenue growth

mappings.reframe_strategy: Reframe agent routing and escalation logic as 'decision systems' — these are rule-based and intent-driven automated decision systems that route customer inquiries to appropriate channels. Emphasize designing decision logic for when to escalate, when to route to self-service vs. human agents, and how to prioritize based on SLAs. This is directly analogous to AI decision systems that determine when to use automation vs. human intervention.

source_experience.bullet: Defined AI roadmap for Dynamic Planning suite (Web + Excel) serving 10,000+ enterprise users — integrated LLM-powered conversational workflows and predictive insights across omnichannel platforms
Prototyped AI workflows, planned LLM-powered agents for autonomous report generation, reducing manual effort by 40%

mappings.reframe_strategy: Position the planning and prototyping of LLM-powered agents for autonomous workflows as work with orchestration frameworks. When discussing, explain how you evaluated orchestration patterns for chaining LLM calls, managing state, and coordinating multi-step AI workflows. Mention familiarity with concepts like agent orchestration, workflow coordination, and multi-step AI pipelines through this prototyping work.

source_experience.bullet: Enhanced ML-assisted models using usage telemetry, embedding scores, and user-behavior clusters to forecast feature ROI, de-risk roadmap decisions, influence org-wide strategy for AI-enabled FP&A modernization

mappings.reframe_strategy: Position work with embedding scores and enriching ML models with telemetry data as understanding of RAG concepts. Explain that you worked with embedding-based retrieval to contextualize model predictions with usage data — which is conceptually similar to RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation). Discuss how you enriched model context with relevant data sources to improve accuracy, which demonstrates understanding of retrieval-augmented approaches.

source_experience.bullet: Worked on both the front and the backend of the application and thoroughly inspected the software after the release of new versions

mappings.reframe_strategy: Leverage technical background as software developer working on frontend and backend integration to demonstrate API understanding. Discuss experience coordinating between application layers, understanding data flows, and ensuring integration between components. As a PM, this translates to evaluating API-based solutions, understanding API design trade-offs, and making build-vs-buy decisions for AI tooling via APIs.

source_experience.bullet: Owned release planning and GTM coordination; built ML-assisted prioritization using telemetry to forecast feature ROI

mappings.reframe_strategy: Frame your ML-assisted prioritization work as experience with model selection decisions. Discuss how you evaluated when to use ML models vs. heuristics for prioritization, assessed model accuracy vs. complexity trade-offs, and decided what level of ML sophistication was appropriate for the business outcome. This demonstrates the 'build vs buy' and 'when to use AI vs rules' judgment the role requires.

mappings.reframe_strategy: Position premium revenue growth experience in fintech as understanding recurring revenue models. Frame conversations around driving recurring revenue, measuring revenue retention, and optimizing for revenue growth metrics. The underlying business mechanics are similar even if terminology differs.
